pages.text: "This is a bucket."$(br)"Dear god..."$(br)"There's more."$(br)"No..."$(p)Fluid tanks are like chemical tanks, but you know, store fluids instead. They can be placed as a block or used in Bucket mode ($(k:sneak) + $(k:key.mekanism.mode) to toggle). They will retain their inventory when broken. They come in the four tiers, each tier being double the capacity
and output rate of its predecessor.

$(bold)As a block:$(br)$()You may use a $(l:pipes/mechanical)Mechanical Pipe$(/l) that is set to Pull in order to extract the fluid out of the tank. ($(k:sneak) + right click on a fluid tank with a $(l:item/configurator)Configurator$(/l) to turn on auto eject mode. This is indicated by the lighter-colored accents on the fluid tank. When auto eject is activated, the fluid tank will automatically eject fluids out of the bottom of the tank.

$(bold)Bucket Mode:$(br)$()You can hold ($(k:sneak) and scroll or $(k:sneak) + $(k:key.mekanism.mode) to change Bucket Mode. If bucket mode is set to True, the fluid tank will act like a bucket, being able to physically dump fluid out (($(k:sneak) + right click) and scoop up fluid (right click).$(p)However, by setting it to True, it also removes the ability to place the fluid tank. Bucket mode must be set to off in order to place the fluid tank.
